TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ImageIndexConverter extends System.ComponentModel.Int32Converter

Docs.summary: Provides a type converter to convert data for an image index to and from a string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageIndexConverter> class is used to convert index values of an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList> to and from other data types, typically <xref:System.String>. For more information about type converters, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/visualstudio/visual-studio-2013/ayybcxe5(v=vs.120)).
> [!NOTE] > Typically, you do not directly create an instance of an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageIndexConverter>. Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor>. For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.

Docs.param: An that provides a format context.
Docs.summary: Converts the specified value object to a 32-bit signed integer object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This type converter only can convert a 32-bit signed integer object to and from a string.
The `context` can be used to extract additional information about the environment this type converter is being invoked from. This may be `null`, so you should always check. Also, properties on the context object may also return `null`.

Docs.exception: The conversion could not be performed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default implementation of this method can only convert an index value represented as an <xref:System.Int32> to a <xref:System.String>.

Docs.param: An that provides a format context, which can be used to extract additional information about the environment this type converter is being invoked from. This parameter or properties of this parameter can be .
Docs.summary: Returns a collection of standard index values for the image list associated with the specified format context.
Docs.returns: A that holds a standard set of valid index values. If no image list is found, this collection will contain a single object with a value of -1.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Returns a collection of index values for image lists associated with the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext.Instance%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property of the `context` parameter. If an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList> is not found, then the parent of the component will be searched for such a list.
Typically the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageIndexConverter.GetStandardValuesSupported%2A> method is called to before an attempt is made to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageIndexConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageIndexConverter.GetStandardValuesExclusive%2A> methods.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool GetStandardValuesExclusive (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool GetStandardValuesExclusive(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context) cil managed

override this.GetStandardValuesExclusive : System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext -> bool

Docs.summary: Determines if the list of standard values returned from the method is an exclusive list.
Docs.returns: if the method returns an exclusive list of valid values; otherwise, . This implementation always returns .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the list returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageIndexConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> method is exclusive, then no other values are valid. This is typical of an enumerated data type. If the list is not exclusive, then there are other valid values besides the list of standard values that <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageIndexConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> provides.
As implemented in this type converter, this method always returns `false`.
Typically the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageIndexConverter.GetStandardValuesSupported%2A> method is called to before an attempt is made to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageIndexConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageIndexConverter.GetStandardValuesExclusive%2A> methods.

Docs.param: An that provides a format context, which can be used to extract additional information about the environment this type converter is being invoked from. This parameter or properties of this parameter can be .
Docs.summary: Determines if the type converter supports a standard set of values that can be picked from a list.
Docs.returns: if the method returns a standard set of values; otherwise, . Always returns .

remarks.format: ## Remarks As implemented in this class, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageIndexConverter.GetStandardValuesSupported%2A> always returns `true` since this object supports a standard set of index values for images that can be picked from a list.
